meanings.sent1: The illaudable behavior of the student led to a detention.
meanings.sent2: His illaudable actions caused disappointment among his peers.
meanings.sent3: It was illaudable how he tried to blame his mistakes on others.
meanings.sent4: The illaudable decision to cheat on the test backfired on him.
meanings.sent5: The illaudable conduct of the employee resulted in his dismissal.

meanings.sent1: The illaudable quality of the product made customers unhappy.
meanings.sent2: Her illaudable attitude towards her colleagues created tension in the office.
meanings.sent3: It was illaudable how he tried to take credit for her hard work.
meanings.sent4: The illaudable attempt to deceive others was quickly exposed.
meanings.sent5: The illaudable behavior of the politician cost him the election.
